item.title: No title
Experience Rating Analysis - ModMaster | Zywave
item.description:
Experience Rating Analysis - ModMaster | Zywave

A ModMaster, in my opinion, should be completed every year you receive your workers’ compensation experience mod from the WCRB or NCCI - Immediately. Wisconsin is actually one of the few states that allows your mod to be refiled in the event you find errors (inaccurate payrolls, class codes, and over-reserved claims). The ModMaster serves many purposes, but it’s a tool that allows you to catch mistakes if you use it appropriately. If you have not seen or heard of a ModMaster before, please contact tom.boudreau@associatedbrc.com

item.title: No title
Risk management for manufacturers: Protect your property, income and other crucial assets
item.description:
Risk management for manufacturers: Protect your property, income and other crucial assets

In this publication, we will first discuss the best practices for protecting your manufacturing plant and contents. Next, we will address the importance of protecting your income stream and paying for the extra expenses that accompany a property loss. Finally, we will address some of the less obvious property exposures that can damage your business.

item.title: Survey: OSHA ranks low on small business regulatory concerns
item.description:
Survey: OSHA ranks low on small business regulatory concerns

Compared to some of the other regulations small businesses face, OSHA isn't a big concern for owners, according to a new survey. Manta's Semi-Annual Wellness Index asked small business owners which regulatory rules were the most confusing. OSHA came in a distant fourth: 33% chose tax regulations as the most confusing 21% said the Affordable Care Act (Obamacare) 15% chose new U.S.

item.title: Best Manufacturing Accounting Software - Review Top 10 Systems for 2016
item.description:
Best Manufacturing Accounting Software - Review Top 10 Systems for 2016

Every company has basic accounting needs, such as general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, inventory and payroll. Accounting for manufacturing companies carries additional requirements. For example, it's important to have features to support job costing, work-in-progress (WIP) reports, change orders and job payroll tracking.

item.title: Motivational Quotes from 49 Intensely Competitive People
item.description:
Motivational Quotes from 49 Intensely Competitive People

Last week I explained why you should never apologize for being competitive, suggested that managers could foster competition by making salaries public and provided a five step guide to compete at work without making enemies. Following along on that theme, this post contains 49 quotes to keep you competitive and motivated.

item.title: 10 million self-driving cars will be on the road by 2020
item.description:
10 million self-driving cars will be on the road by 2020

Self-driving cars are no longer a futuristic idea. Companies like Mercedes, BMW, and Tesla have already released, or are soon to release, self-driving features that give the car some ability to drive itself. Tech companies are also trying to pioneer the self-driving car.

item.title: Midlife Back Pain Traced to Heavy Physical Work Habits in Youth
item.description:
Midlife Back Pain Traced to Heavy Physical Work Habits in Youth

Young adults with jobs that involve heavy lifting and forceful movements might be at higher risk for back pain later in life, a study from Finland suggests. "When you're young, you do things your own way, you muscle your way through it, but sooner or later, that behavior can cause problems," said Michael Timko, a physical therapist and instructor at the University of Pittsburgh who was not involved with the study.
